info.title: lbrycrd RPC API
info.version: LBRYcrd Core RPC client version v0.12.2.0-6fa9ee58-dirty

abandonclaim.summary: Create a transaction which spends a txout which assigned a value to a name, effectively abandoning that claim.

txid.description: The transaction containing the unspent txout which should be spent.

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to send to.

amount.description: The amount to send to the lbrycrd address. eg 0.1

abandonsupport.summary: Create a transaction which spends a txout which supported a name claim, effectively abandoning that support.

txid.description: The transaction containing the unspent txout which should be spent.

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to send to.

amount.description: The amount to send to the lbrycrd address. eg 0.1

claimname.summary: Create a transaction which issues a claim assigning a value to a name. The claim will be authoritative if the transaction amount is greater than the transaction amount of all other unspent transactions which issue a claim over the same name, and it will remain authoritative as long as it remains unspent and there are no other greater unspent transactions issuing a claim over the same name. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest 0.00000001

name.description: The name to be assigned the value.

value.description: The value to assign to the name encoded in hexadecimal.

amount.description: The amount in LBRYcrd to send. eg 0.1

getclaimbyid.summary: Get a claim by claim id

txid.description: the hash of the transaction which has successfully claimed this name

effective amount.description: txout amount plus amount from all supports associated with the claim

height.description: the height of the block in which this claim transaction is located

valid at height.description: the height at which the claim is valid

n.description: the index of the support in the transaction's list of outputs

height.description: the height at which the support was included in the blockchain

valid at height.description: the height at which the support is valid

getclaimsforname.summary: Return all claims and supports for a name

name.description: the name for which to get claims and supports

nLastTakeoverheight.description: the last height at which ownership of the name changed

n.description: the index of the claim in the transaction's list of outputs

nHeight.description: the height at which the claim was included in the blockchain

nValidAtHeight.description: the height at which the claim became/becomes valid

nEffectiveAmount.description: the total effective amount of the claim, taking into effect whether the claim or support has reached its nValidAtHeight

n.description: the index of the support in the transaction's list of outputs

nHeight.description: the height at which the support was included in the blockchain

nValidAtHeight.description: the height at which the support became/becomes valid

n.description: the index of the support in the transaction's list of outputs

nHeight.description: the height at which the support was included in the blockchain

nValidAtHeight.description: the height at which the support became/becomes valid

getclaimsfortx.summary: Return any claims or supports found in a transaction

txid.description: the txid of the transaction to check for unspent claims

nOut.description: the index of the claim or support in the transaction's list out outputs

value.description: if a name claim, the value of the claim

supported txid.description: if a support, the txid of the supported claim

supported nout.description: if a support, the index of the supported claim in its transaction

depth.description: the depth of the transaction in the main chain

in claim trie.description: if a name claim, whether the claim is active, i.e. has made it into the trie

is controlling.description: if a name claim, whether the claim is the current controlling claim for the name

in support map.description: if a support, whether the support is active, i.e. has made it into the support map

in queue.description: whether the claim is in a queue waiting to be inserted into the trie or support map

blocks to valid.description: if in a queue, the number of blocks until it's inserted into the trie or support map

getclaimsintrie.summary: Return all claims in the name trie.

n.description: the vout value of the claim

height.description: the height of the block in which this transaction is located

txid.description: (if value exists) the hash of the transaction which has successfully claimed this name

height.description: (if value exists) the height of the block in which this transaction is located

getnameproof.summary: Return the cryptographic proof that a name maps to a value or doesn't.

name.description: the name to get a proof for

blockhash.description: the hash of the block which is the basis of the proof. If none is given, the latest block will be used.

valueHash.description: the hash of this node's value, if it has one. If  this is the requested name this will not exist whether the node has a value or not

txhash.description: the txid of the claim which controls this name, if there is one.

nOut.description: the nOut of the claim which controls this name, if there is one.

last takeover height.description: the most recent height at which the value of a name changed other than through an update to the winning bid

gettotalclaimednames.summary: Return the total number of names that have been successfully claimed, and therefore exist in the trie

result.description: the total number of names in the trie

gettotalclaims.summary: Return the total number of active claims in the trie

result.description: the total number of active claims

gettotalvalueofclaims.summary: Return the total value of the claims in the trie

controlling_only.description: only include the value of controlling claims

result.description: the total value of the claims in the trie

getvalueforname.summary: Return the value associated with a name, if one exists

result.description: the value of the name, if it exists "claimId" (string) the claimId for this name claim "txid" (string) the hash of the transaction which successfully claimed the name "n" (numeric) vout value "amount" (numeric) txout amount "effective amount" (numeric) txout amount plus amount from all supports associated with the claim "height" (numeric) the height of the block in which this transaction is located

listnameclaims.summary: Return a list of all transactions claiming names.

includesupports.description: Whether to also include claim supports. Default is true.

activeonly.description: Whether to only include transactions which are still active, i.e. have not been spent. Default is false.

minconf.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many time.

value.description: The value assigned to the name, if claimtype is CLAIM.

account.description: The account name associated with the transaction.  It will be "" for the default account.

address.description: The lbrycrd address of the transaction.

fee.description: The amount of the fee in LBC.

height.description: The height of the block in which this transaction was included.

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations for the transaction

blockhash.description: The block hash containing the transaction.

blockindex.description: The block index containing the transaction.

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT).

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT).

comment.description: If a comment is associated with the transaction.

supportclaim.summary: Increase the value of a claim. Whichever claim has the greatest value, including all support values, will be the authoritative claim, according to the rest of the rules. The name is the name which is claimed by the claim that will be supported, the txid is the txid of the claim that will be supported, nout is the transaction output which contains the claim to be supported, and amount is the amount which will be added to the value of the claim. If the claim is currently the authoritative claim, this support will go into effect immediately. Otherwise, it will go into effect after 100 blocks. The support will be in effect until it is spent, and will lose its effect when the claim is spent or expires. The amount is a real and is rounded to the nearest .00000001

name.description: The name claimed by the claim to support.

claimid.description: The claimid of the claim to support. This can be obtained by TODO PUT IN PLACE THAT SHOWS THIS.

amount.description: The amount in LBC to use to support the claim.

result.description: The transaction id of the support.

updateclaim.summary: Create a transaction which issues a claim assigning a value to a name, spending the previous txout which issued a claim over the same name and therefore superseding that claim. The claim will be authoritative if the transaction amount is greater than the transaction amount of all other unspent transactions which issue a claim over the same name, and it will remain authoritative as long as it remains unspent and there are no greater unspent transactions issuing a claim over the same name.

txid.description: The transaction containing the unspent txout which should be spent.

value.description: The value to assign to the name encoded in hexadecimal.

amount.description: The amount in LBRYcrd to use to bid for the name. eg 0.1

getbestblockhash.summary: Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain. Result "hex" (string) the block hash hex encoded

getblock.summary: If verbose is false, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for block 'hash'. If verbose is true, returns an Object with information about block <hash>.

verbose.description: true for a json object, false for the hex encoded data

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations, or -1 if the block is not on the main chain

versionHex.description: The block version formatted in hexadecimal

nameclaimroot.description: The hash of the root of the name claim trie

time.description: The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

mediantime.description: The median block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

chainwork.description: Expected number of hashes required to produce the chain up to this block (in hex)

previousblockhash.description: The hash of the previous block

nextblockhash.description: The hash of the next block

getblockchaininfo.summary: Returns an object containing various state info regarding block chain processing.

chain.description: current network name as defined in BIP70 (main, test, regtest)

blocks.description: the current number of blocks processed in the server

headers.description: the current number of headers we have validated

bestblockhash.description: the hash of the currently best block

mediantime.description: median time for the current best block

chainwork.description: total amount of work in active chain, in hexadecimal

pruned.description: if the blocks are subject to pruning

found.description: number of blocks with the new version found

required.description: number of blocks required to trigger

window.description: maximum size of examined window of recent blocks

bit.description: the bit, 0-28, in the block version field used to signal this soft fork

startTime.description: the minimum median time past of a block at which the bit gains its meaning

timeout.description: the median time past of a block at which the deployment is considered failed if not yet locked in

getblockcount.summary: Returns the number of blocks in the longest block chain.

getblockhash.summary: Returns hash of block in best-block-chain at index provided.

getblockheader.summary: If verbose is false, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for blockheader 'hash'. If verbose is true, returns an Object with information about blockheader <hash>.

verbose.description: true for a json object, false for the hex encoded data

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations, or -1 if the block is not on the main chain

versionHex.description: The block version formatted in hexadecimal

time.description: The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

mediantime.description: The median block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

previousblockhash.description: The hash of the previous block

nextblockhash.description: The hash of the next block

chainwork.description: Expected number of hashes required to produce the current chain (in hex)

getchaintips.summary: Return information about all known tips in the block tree, including the main chain as well as orphaned branches.

branchlen.description: length of branch connecting the tip to the main chain

status.description: status of the chain (active, valid-fork, valid-headers, headers-only, invalid)

getdifficulty.summary: Returns the proof-of-work difficulty as a multiple of the minimum difficulty.

result.description: the proof-of-work difficulty as a multiple of the minimum difficulty.

getmempoolinfo.summary: Returns details on the active state of the TX memory pool.

usage.description: Total memory usage for the mempool

maxmempool.description: Maximum memory usage for the mempool

mempoolminfee.description: Minimum fee for tx to be accepted

getrawmempool.summary: Returns all transaction ids in memory pool as a json array of string transaction ids.

verbose.description: true for a json object, false for array of transaction ids

gettxout.summary: Returns details about an unspent transaction output.

includemempool.description: Whether to include the mem pool

gettxoutproof.summary: Returns a hex-encoded proof that "txid" was included in a block. NOTE: By default this function only works sometimes. This is when there is an unspent output in the utxo for this transaction. To make it always work, you need to maintain a transaction index, using the -txindex command line option or specify the block in which the transaction is included in manually (by blockhash). Return the raw transaction data.

txids.description: A json array of txids to filter [ "txid" (string) A transaction hash ,... ]

block hash.description: If specified, looks for txid in the block with this hash

result.description: A string that is a serialized, hex-encoded data for the proof.

gettxoutsetinfo.summary: Returns statistics about the unspent transaction output set. Note this call may take some time.

checklevel.description: How thorough the block verification is.

numblocks.description: The number of blocks to check.

verifytxoutproof.summary: Verifies that a proof points to a transaction in a block, returning the transaction it commits to and throwing an RPC error if the block is not in our best chain

proof.description: The hex-encoded proof generated by gettxoutproof

getinfo.summary: Returns an object containing various state info.

balance.description: the total lbrycrd balance of the wallet

blocks.description: the current number of blocks processed in the server

proxy.description: the proxy used by the server

testnet.description: if the server is using testnet or not

keypoololdest.description: the timestamp (seconds since GMT epoch) of the oldest pre-generated key in the key pool

keypoolsize.description: how many new keys are pre-generated

unlocked_until.description: the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked

paytxfee.description: the transaction fee set in LBC/kB

relayfee.description: minimum relay fee for non-free transactions in LBC/kB

help.summary: List all commands, or get help for a specified command.

command.description: The command to get help on

generate.summary: Mine up to numblocks blocks immediately (before the RPC call returns)

numblocks.description: How many blocks are generated immediately.

maxtries.description: How many iterations to try (default = 1000000). Result [ blockhashes ] (array) hashes of blocks generated

generatetoaddress.summary: Mine blocks immediately to a specified address (before the RPC call returns)

numblocks.description: How many blocks are generated immediately.

address.description: The address to send the newly generated bitcoin to.

maxtries.description: How many iterations to try (default = 1000000). Result [ blockhashes ] (array) hashes of blocks generated

getblocktemplate.summary: If the request parameters include a 'mode' key, that is used to explicitly select between the default 'template' request or a 'proposal'. It returns data needed to construct a block to work on. See https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/BIP_0022 for full specification.

jsonrequestobject.description: A json object in the following spec { "mode":"template" (string, optional) This must be set to "template" or omitted "capabilities":[ (array, optional) A list of strings "support" (string) client side supported feature, 'longpoll', 'coinbasetxn', 'coinbasevalue', 'proposal', 'serverlist', 'workid' ,... ] }

previousblockhash.description: The hash of current highest block

n.description: transactions before this one (by 1-based index in 'transactions' list) that must be present in the final block if this one is

fee.description: difference in value between transaction inputs and outputs (in Satoshis); for coinbase transactions, this is a negative Number of the total collected block fees (ie, not including the block subsidy); if key is not present, fee is unknown and clients MUST NOT assume there isn't one

sigops.description: total number of SigOps, as counted for purposes of block limits; if key is not present, sigop count is unknown and clients MUST NOT assume there aren't any

required.description: if provided and true, this transaction must be in the final block

coinbasevalue.description: maximum allowable input to coinbase transaction, including the generation award and transaction fees (in Satoshis)

mintime.description: The minimum timestamp appropriate for next block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

value.description: A way the block template may be changed, e.g. 'time', 'transactions', 'prevblock'

curtime.description: current timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

height.description: The height of the next block

getgenerate.summary: Return if the server is set to generate coins or not. The default is false. It is set with the command line argument -gen (or lbrycrd.conf setting gen) It can also be set with the setgenerate call. Result true|false (boolean) If the server is set to generate coins or not

gethashespersec.summary: Returns a recent hashes per second performance measurement while generating. See the getgenerate and setgenerate calls to turn generation on and off.

result.description: The recent hashes per second when generation is on (will return 0 if generation is off)

getmininginfo.summary: Returns a json object containing mining-related information.

generate.description: If the generation is on or off (see getgenerate or setgenerate calls)

genproclimit.description: The processor limit for generation. -1 if no generation. (see getgenerate or setgenerate calls)

hashespersec.description: The hashes per second of the generation, or 0 if no generation.

pooledtx.description: The size of the mem pool

chain.description: current network name as defined in BIP70 (main, test, regtest)

getnetworkhashps.summary: Returns the estimated network hashes per second based on the last n blocks. Pass in [blocks] to override # of blocks, -1 specifies since last difficulty change. Pass in [height] to estimate the network speed at the time when a certain block was found.

blocks.description: The number of blocks, or -1 for blocks since last difficulty change.

height.description: To estimate at the time of the given height.

prioritisetransaction.summary: Accepts the transaction into mined blocks at a higher (or lower) priority

priority delta.description: The priority to add or subtract. The transaction selection algorithm considers the tx as it would have a higher priority. (priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

fee delta.description: The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative). The fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee. Result true (boolean) Returns true

setgenerate.summary: Set 'generate' true or false to turn generation on or off. Generation is limited to 'genproclimit' processors, -1 is unlimited. See the getgenerate call for the current setting.
description: Set the generation on with a limit of one processor

generate.description: Set to true to turn on generation, off to turn off.

genproclimit.description: Set the processor limit for when generation is on. Can be -1 for unlimited.

submitblock.summary: Attempts to submit new block to network. The 'jsonparametersobject' parameter is currently ignored. See https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/BIP_0022 for full specification.

hexdata.description: the hex-encoded block data to submit

jsonparametersobject.description: object of optional parameters { "workid" : "id" (string, optional) if the server provided a workid, it MUST be included with submissions }

addnode.summary: Attempts add or remove a node from the addnode list. Or try a connection to a node once.

command.description: 'add' to add a node to the list, 'remove' to remove a node from the list, 'onetry' to try a connection to the node once

disconnectnode.summary: Immediately disconnects from the specified node.

getaddednodeinfo.summary: Returns information about the given added node, or all added nodes (note that onetry addnodes are not listed here) If dns is false, only a list of added nodes will be provided, otherwise connected information will also be available.

dns.description: If false, only a list of added nodes will be provided, otherwise connected information will also be available.

node.description: If provided, return information about this specific node, otherwise all nodes are returned.

address.description: The lbrycrd server host and port

getconnectioncount.summary: Returns the number of connections to other nodes.

getnettotals.summary: Returns information about network traffic, including bytes in, bytes out, and current time.

timeframe.description: Length of the measuring timeframe in seconds

bytes_left_in_cycle.description: Bytes left in current time cycle

time_left_in_cycle.description: Seconds left in current time cycle

getnetworkinfo.summary: Returns an object containing various state info regarding P2P networking.

localservices.description: the services we offer to the network

proxy.description: the proxy that is used for this network, or empty if none

relayfee.description: minimum relay fee for non-free transactions in LBC/kB

warnings.description: any network warnings (such as alert messages)

getpeerinfo.summary: Returns data about each connected network node as a json array of objects.

addr.description: The ip address and port of the peer

relaytxes.description: Whether peer has asked us to relay transactions to it

lastsend.description: The time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) of the last send

lastrecv.description: The time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) of the last receive

conntime.description: The connection time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

minping.description: minimum observed ping time (if any at all)

startingheight.description: The starting height (block) of the peer

synced_headers.description: The last header we have in common with this peer

synced_blocks.description: The last block we have in common with this peer

n,.description: The heights of blocks we're currently asking from this peer

addr.description: The total bytes sent aggregated by message type
The total bytes received aggregated by message type

ping.summary: Requests that a ping be sent to all other nodes, to measure ping time. Results provided in getpeerinfo, pingtime and pingwait fields are decimal seconds. Ping command is handled in queue with all other commands, so it measures processing backlog, not just network ping.

setban.summary: Attempts add or remove a IP/Subnet from the banned list.

ip(/netmask).description: The IP/Subnet (see getpeerinfo for nodes ip) with a optional netmask (default is /32 = single ip)

command.description: 'add' to add a IP/Subnet to the list, 'remove' to remove a IP/Subnet from the list

bantime.description: time in seconds how long (or until when if [absolute] is set) the ip is banned (0 or empty means using the default time of 24h which can also be overwritten by the -bantime startup argument)

absolute.description: If set, the bantime must be a absolute timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)

createrawtransaction.summary: Create a transaction spending the given inputs and creating new outputs. Outputs can be addresses or data. Returns hex-encoded raw transaction. Note that the transaction's inputs are not signed, and it is not stored in the wallet or transmitted to the network.

transactions.description: A json array of json objects [ { "txid":"id", (string, required) The transaction id "vout":n (numeric, required) The output number } ,... ]

outputs.description: a json object with outputs { "address": x.xxx (numeric or string, required) The key is the lbrycrd address, the numeric value (can be string) is the LBC amount "data": "hex", (string, required) The key is "data", the value is hex encoded data ... }

locktime.description: Raw locktime. Non-0 value also locktime-activates inputs

decoderawtransaction.summary: Return a JSON object representing the serialized, hex-encoded transaction.

fundrawtransaction.summary: Add inputs to a transaction until it has enough in value to meet its out value. This will not modify existing inputs, and will add one change output to the outputs. Note that inputs which were signed may need to be resigned after completion since in/outputs have been added. The inputs added will not be signed, use signrawtransaction for that. Note that all existing inputs must have their previous output transaction be in the wallet. Note that all inputs selected must be of standard form and P2SH scripts must be in the wallet using importaddress or addmultisigaddress (to calculate fees). Only pay-to-pubkey, multisig, and P2SH versions thereof are currently supported for watch-only
description: Create a transaction with no inputs
Add sufficient unsigned inputs to meet the output value

hexstring.description: The hex string of the raw transaction

changeAddress.description: The bitcoin address to receive the change

changePosition.description: The index of the change output

includeWatching.description: Also select inputs which are watch only

changepos.description: The position of the added change output, or -1

getrawtransaction.summary: NOTE: By default this function only works sometimes. This is when the tx is in the mempool or there is an unspent output in the utxo for this transaction. To make it always work, you need to maintain a transaction index, using the -txindex command line option. Return the raw transaction data. If verbose=0, returns a string that is serialized, hex-encoded data for 'txid'. If verbose is non-zero, returns an Object with information about 'txid'.

verbose.description: If 0, return a string, other return a json object

result.description: The serialized, hex-encoded data for 'txid' Result (if verbose > 0): { "hex" : "data", (string) The serialized, hex-encoded data for 'txid' "txid" : "id", (string) The transaction id (same as provided) "size" : n, (numeric) The transaction size "version" : n, (numeric) The version "locktime" : ttt, (numeric) The lock time "vin" : [ (array of json objects) { "txid": "id", (string) The transaction id "vout": n, (numeric) "scriptSig": { (json object) The script "asm": "asm", (string) asm "hex": "hex" (string) hex }, "sequence": n (numeric) The script sequence number } ,... ], "vout" : [ (array of json objects) { "value" : x.xxx, (numeric) The value in LBC "n" : n, (numeric) index "scriptPubKey" : { (json object) "asm" : "asm", (string) the asm "hex" : "hex", (string) the hex "reqSigs" : n, (numeric) The required sigs "type" : "pubkeyhash", (string) The type, eg 'pubkeyhash' "addresses" : [ (json array of string) "lbrycrdaddress" (string) lbrycrd address ,... ] } } ,... ], "blockhash" : "hash", (string) the block hash "confirmations" : n, (numeric) The confirmations "time" : ttt, (numeric) The transaction time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) "blocktime" : ttt (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT) }

sendrawtransaction.summary: Submits raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded) to local node and network. Also see createrawtransaction and signrawtransaction calls.
description: Sign the transaction, and get back the hex

hexstring.description: The hex string of the raw transaction)

signrawtransaction.summary: Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded). The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that this transaction depends on but may not yet be in the block chain. The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.

prevtxs.description: An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs [ (json array of json objects, or 'null' if none provided) { "txid":"id", (string, required) The transaction id "vout":n, (numeric, required) The output number "scriptPubKey": "hex", (string, required) script key "redeemScript": "hex" (string, required for P2SH) redeem script } ,... ]

privatekeys.description: A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing [ (json array of strings, or 'null' if none provided) "privatekey" (string) private key in base58-encoding ,... ]

sighashtype.description: The signature hash type. Must be one of "ALL" "NONE" "SINGLE" "ALL|ANYONECANPAY" "NONE|ANYONECANPAY" "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

hex.description: The hex-encoded raw transaction with signature(s)

complete.description: If the transaction has a complete set of signatures

txid.description: The hash of the referenced, previous transaction

vout.description: The index of the output to spent and used as input

error.description: Verification or signing error related to the input

createmultisig.summary: Creates a multi-signature address with n signature of m keys required. It returns a json object with the address and redeemScript.
description: Create a multisig address from 2 addresses

nrequired.description: The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses.

keys.description: A json array of keys which are lbrycrd addresses or hex-encoded public keys [ "key" (string) lbrycrd address or hex-encoded public key ,... ]

address.description: The value of the new multisig address.

redeemScript.description: The string value of the hex-encoded redemption script.

estimatefee.summary: Estimates the approximate fee per kilobyte needed for a transaction to begin confirmation within nblocks blocks.

result.description: estimated fee-per-kilobyte A negative value is returned if not enough transactions and blocks have been observed to make an estimate.

estimatepriority.summary: Estimates the approximate priority a zero-fee transaction needs to begin confirmation within nblocks blocks.

result.description: estimated priority A negative value is returned if not enough transactions and blocks have been observed to make an estimate.

estimatesmartfee.summary: WARNING: This interface is unstable and may disappear or change! Estimates the approximate fee per kilobyte needed for a transaction to begin confirmation within nblocks blocks if possible and return the number of blocks for which the estimate is valid.

blocks.description: block number where estimate was found

estimatesmartpriority.summary: WARNING: This interface is unstable and may disappear or change! Estimates the approximate priority a zero-fee transaction needs to begin confirmation within nblocks blocks if possible and return the number of blocks for which the estimate is valid.

blocks.description: block number where estimate was found

validateaddress.summary: Return information about the given lbrycrd address.

isvalid.description: If the address is valid or not. If not, this is the only property returned.

scriptPubKey.description: The hex encoded scriptPubKey generated by the address

ismine.description: If the address is yours or not

isscript.description: If the key is a script

pubkey.description: The hex value of the raw public key

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account associated with the address, "" is the default account

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to use for the signature.

signature.description: The signature provided by the signer in base 64 encoding (see signmessage).

result.description: If the signature is verified or not.

abandontransaction.summary: Mark in-wallet transaction <txid> as abandoned This will mark this transaction and all its in-wallet descendants as abandoned which will allow for their inputs to be respent. It can be used to replace "stuck" or evicted transactions. It only works on transactions which are not included in a block and are not currently in the mempool. It has no effect on transactions which are already conflicted or abandoned.

addmultisigaddress.summary: Add a nrequired-to-sign multisignature address to the wallet. Each key is a Bitcoin address or hex-encoded public key. If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), assign address to that account.
description: Add a multisig address from 2 addresses

nrequired.description: The number of required signatures out of the n keys or addresses.

keysobject.description: A json array of lbrycrd addresses or hex-encoded public keys [ "address" (string) lbrycrd address or hex-encoded public key ..., ]

account.description: DEPRECATED. An account to assign the addresses to.

result.description: A lbrycrd address associated with the keys.

backupwallet.summary: Safely copies current wallet file to destination, which can be a directory or a path with filename.

dumpprivkey.summary: Reveals the private key corresponding to 'lbrycrdaddress'. Then the importprivkey can be used with this output

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address for the private key

dumpwallet.summary: Dumps all wallet keys in a human-readable format.

encryptwallet.summary: Encrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption. After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls. Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
description: Now set the passphrase to use the wallet, such as for signing or sending LBC
Now we can so something like sign
Now lock the wallet again by removing the passphrase
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "encryptwallet", "params": ["my pass phrase"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:9245/

passphrase.description: The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long.

getaccount.summary: DEPRECATED. Returns the account associated with the given address.

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address for account lookup.

getaccountaddress.summary: DEPRECATED. Returns the current Bitcoin address for receiving payments to this account.

account.description: The account name for the address. It can also be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. The account does not need to exist, it will be created and a new address created if there is no account by the given name.

getaddressesbyaccount.summary: DEPRECATED. Returns the list of addresses for the given account.

lbrycrdaddress.description: a lbrycrd address associated with the given account

getbalance.summary: If account is not specified, returns the server's total available balance. If account is specified (DEPRECATED), returns the balance in the account. Note that the account "" is not the same as leaving the parameter out. The server total may be different to the balance in the default "" account.
description: The total amount in the wallet
The total amount in the wallet at least 5 blocks confirmed

account.description: DEPRECATED. The selected account, or "*" for entire wallet. It may be the default account using "".

minconf.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

includeWatchonly.description: Also include balance in watchonly addresses (see 'importaddress')

result.description: The total amount in LBC received for this account.

getnewaddress.summary: Returns a new Bitcoin address for receiving payments. If 'account' is specified (DEPRECATED), it is added to the address book so payments received with the address will be credited to 'account'.

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name for the address to be linked to. If not provided, the default account "" is used. It can also be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. The account does not need to exist, it will be created if there is no account by the given name.

getrawchangeaddress.summary: Returns a new Bitcoin address, for receiving change. This is for use with raw transactions, NOT normal use.

getreceivedbyaccount.summary: DEPRECATED. Returns the total amount received by addresses with <account> in transactions with at least [minconf] confirmations.
description: Amount received by the default account with at least 1 confirmation
Amount received at the tabby account including unconfirmed amounts with zero confirmations
The amount with at least 6 confirmation, very safe

account.description: The selected account, may be the default account using "".

minconf.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

result.description: The total amount in LBC received for this account.

getreceivedbyaddress.summary: Returns the total amount received by the given lbrycrdaddress in transactions with at least minconf confirmations.
description: The amount from transactions with at least 1 confirmation
The amount including unconfirmed transactions, zero confirmations
The amount with at least 6 confirmation, very safe

minconf.description: Only include transactions confirmed at least this many times.

result.description: The total amount in LBC received at this address.

gettransaction.summary: Get detailed information about in-wallet transaction <txid>

includeWatchonly.description: Whether to include watchonly addresses in balance calculation and details[]

blockindex.description: The index of the transaction in the block that includes it

blocktime.description: The time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT)

bip125-replaceable.description: Whether this transaction could be replaced due to BIP125 (replace-by-fee); may be unknown for unconfirmed transactions not in the mempool

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name involved in the transaction, can be "" for the default account.

address.description: The lbrycrd address involved in the transaction

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

getunconfirmedbalance.summary: Returns the server's total unconfirmed balance

getwalletinfo.summary: Returns an object containing various wallet state info.

balance.description: the total confirmed balance of the wallet in LBC

unconfirmed_balance.description: the total unconfirmed balance of the wallet in LBC

immature_balance.description: the total immature balance of the wallet in LBC

txcount.description: the total number of transactions in the wallet

keypoololdest.description: the timestamp (seconds since GMT epoch) of the oldest pre-generated key in the key pool

keypoolsize.description: how many new keys are pre-generated

unlocked_until.description: the timestamp in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT) that the wallet is unlocked for transfers, or 0 if the wallet is locked

paytxfee.description: the transaction fee configuration, set in LBC/kB

importaddress.summary: Adds a script (in hex) or address that can be watched as if it were in your wallet but cannot be used to spend.
description: Import using a label without rescan

p2sh.description: Add the P2SH version of the script as well Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true. If you have the full public key, you should call importpubkey instead of this.

importprivkey.summary: Adds a private key (as returned by dumpprivkey) to your wallet.
description: Import the private key with rescan
Import using a label and without rescan

rescan.description: Rescan the wallet for transactions Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true.

importprunedfunds.summary: Imports funds without rescan. Corresponding address or script must previously be included in wallet. Aimed towards pruned wallets. The end-user is responsible to import additional transactions that subsequently spend the imported outputs or rescan after the point in the blockchain the transaction is included.

rawtransaction.description: A raw transaction in hex funding an already-existing address in wallet

txoutproof.description: The hex output from gettxoutproof that contains the transaction

importpubkey.summary: Adds a public key (in hex) that can be watched as if it were in your wallet but cannot be used to spend.
description: Import a public key with rescan
Import using a label without rescan

rescan.description: Rescan the wallet for transactions Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true.

importwallet.summary: Imports keys from a wallet dump file (see dumpwallet).
description: Import using the json rpc call

listaccounts.summary: DEPRECATED. Returns Object that has account names as keys, account balances as values.
description: List account balances where there at least 1 confirmation
List account balances including zero confirmation transactions
List account balances for 6 or more confirmations

minconf.description: Only include transactions with at least this many confirmations

account.description: The property name is the account name, and the value is the total balance for the account.

listaddressgroupings.summary: Lists groups of addresses which have had their common ownership made public by common use as inputs or as the resulting change in past transactions

listlockunspent.summary: Returns list of temporarily unspendable outputs. See the lockunspent call to lock and unlock transactions for spending.

description: > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listreceivedbyaccount", "params": [6, true, true] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:9245/

minconf.description: The minimum number of confirmations before payments are included.

includeempty.description: Whether to include accounts that haven't received any payments.

involvesWatchonly.description: Only returned if imported addresses were involved in transaction

account.description: The account name of the receiving account

amount.description: The total amount received by addresses with this account

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations of the most recent transaction included

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

description: > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listreceivedbyaddress", "params": [6, true, true] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:9245/

minconf.description: The minimum number of confirmations before payments are included.

includeempty.description: Whether to include addresses that haven't received any payments.

involvesWatchonly.description: Only returned if imported addresses were involved in transaction

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account of the receiving address. The default account is "".

amount.description: The total amount in LBC received by the address

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations of the most recent transaction included

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

listsinceblock.summary: Get all transactions in blocks since block [blockhash], or all transactions if omitted

blockhash.description: The block hash to list transactions since

target-confirmations.description: The confirmations required, must be 1 or more

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name associated with the transaction. Will be "" for the default account.

address.description: The lbrycrd address of the transaction. Not present for move transactions (category = move).

category.description: The transaction category. 'send' has negative amounts, 'receive' has positive amounts.

amount.description: The amount in LBC. This is negative for the 'send' category, and for the 'move' category for moves  outbound. It is positive for the 'receive' category, and for the 'move' category for inbound funds.

fee.description: The amount of the fee in LBC. This is negative and only available for the 'send' category of transactions.

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations for the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blockhash.description: The block hash containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blockindex.description: The index of the transaction in the block that includes it. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blocktime.description: The block time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT).

txid.description: The transaction id. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT).

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT). Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

comment.description: If a comment is associated with the transaction.

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

to.description: If a comment to is associated with the transaction.

lastblock.description: The hash of the last block

listtransactions.summary: Returns up to 'count' most recent transactions skipping the first 'from' transactions for account 'account'.
description: List the most recent 10 transactions in the systems

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name. Should be "*".

count.description: The number of transactions to return

from.description: The number of transactions to skip

account.description: DEPRECATED. The account name associated with the transaction.  It will be "" for the default account.

address.description: The lbrycrd address of the transaction. Not present for  move transactions (category = move).

category.description: The transaction category. 'move' is a local (off blockchain) transaction between accounts, and not associated with an address, transaction id or block. 'send' and 'receive' transactions are  associated with an address, transaction id and block details

amount.description: The amount in LBC. This is negative for the 'send' category, and for the 'move' category for moves outbound. It is positive for the 'receive' category, and for the 'move' category for inbound funds.

fee.description: The amount of the fee in LBC. This is negative and only available for the  'send' category of transactions.

abandoned.description: 'true' if the transaction has been abandoned (inputs are respendable).

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations for the transaction. Available for 'send' and  'receive' category of transactions. Negative confirmations indicate the transaction conflicts with the block chain

trusted.description: Whether we consider the outputs of this unconfirmed transaction safe to spend.

blockhash.description: The block hash containing the transaction. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blockindex.description: The index of the transaction in the block that includes it. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

blocktime.description: The block time in seconds since epoch (1 Jan 1970 GMT).

txid.description: The transaction id. Available for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

time.description: The transaction time in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT).

timereceived.description: The time received in seconds since epoch (midnight Jan 1 1970 GMT). Available  for 'send' and 'receive' category of transactions.

comment.description: If a comment is associated with the transaction.

label.description: A comment for the address/transaction, if any

otheraccount.description: For the 'move' category of transactions, the account the funds came  from (for receiving funds, positive amounts), or went to (for sending funds, negative amounts).

bip125-replaceable.description: Whether this transaction could be replaced due to BIP125 (replace-by-fee); may be unknown for unconfirmed transactions not in the mempool

listunspent.summary: Returns array of unspent transaction outputs with between minconf and maxconf (inclusive) confirmations. Optionally filter to only include txouts paid to specified addresses. Results are an array of Objects, each of which has: {txid, vout, scriptPubKey, amount, confirmations}

addresses.description: A json array of lbrycrd addresses to filter [ "address" (string) lbrycrd address ,... ] Result [ (array of json object) { "txid" : "txid", (string) the transaction id "vout" : n, (numeric) the vout value "address" : "address", (string) the lbrycrd address "account" : "account", (string) DEPRECATED. The associated account, or "" for the default account "scriptPubKey" : "key", (string) the script key "amount" : x.xxx, (numeric) the transaction amount in LBC "confirmations" : n (numeric) The number of confirmations } ,... ]

lockunspent.summary: Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs. Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs. If no transaction outputs are specified when unlocking then all current locked transaction outputs are unlocked. A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending LBC. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails. Also see the listunspent call

unlock.description: Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions

transactions.description: A json array of objects. Each object the txid (string) vout (numeric) [ (json array of json objects) { "txid":"id", (string) The transaction id "vout": n (numeric) The output number } ,... ]

result.description: Whether the command was successful or not

move.summary: DEPRECATED. Move a specified amount from one account in your wallet to another.
description: Move 0.01 LBC from the default account to the account named tabby
Move 0.01 LBC timotei to akiko with a comment and funds have 6 confirmations

fromaccount.description: The name of the account to move funds from. May be the default account using "".

toaccount.description: The name of the account to move funds to. May be the default account using "".

amount.description: Quantity of LBC to move between accounts.

minconf.description: Only use funds with at least this many confirmations.

comment.description: An optional comment, stored in the wallet only.

removeprunedfunds.summary: Deletes the specified transaction from the wallet. Meant for use with pruned wallets and as a companion to importprunedfunds. This will effect wallet balances.

txid.description: The hex-encoded id of the transaction you are deleting

sendfrom.summary: DEPRECATED (use sendtoaddress). Sent an amount from an account to a lbrycrd address.
description: Send 0.01 LBC from the default account to the address, must have at least 1 confirmation
Send 0.01 from the tabby account to the given address, funds must have at least 6 confirmations

fromaccount.description: The name of the account to send funds from. May be the default account using "".

tolbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to send funds to.

amount.description: The amount in LBC (transaction fee is added on top).

minconf.description: Only use funds with at least this many confirmations.

comment.description: A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

comment-to.description: An optional comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, it is just kept in your wallet.

sendmany.summary: Send multiple times. Amounts are double-precision floating point numbers.
description: Send two amounts to two different addresses:
Send two amounts to two different addresses setting the confirmation and comment:
Send two amounts to two different addresses, subtract fee from amount:

fromaccount.description: DEPRECATED. The account to send the funds from. Should be "" for the default account

amounts.description: A json object with addresses and amounts { "address":amount (numeric or string) The lbrycrd address is the key, the numeric amount (can be string) in LBC is the value ,... }

minconf.description: Only use the balance confirmed at least this many times.

subtractfeefromamount.description: A json array with addresses. The fee will be equally deducted from the amount of each selected address. Those recipients will receive less LBC than you enter in their corresponding amount field. If no addresses are specified here, the sender pays the fee. [ "address" (string) Subtract fee from this address ,... ]

result.description: The transaction id for the send. Only 1 transaction is created regardless of the number of addresses.

sendtoaddress.summary: Send an amount to a given address.

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to send to.

amount.description: The amount in LBC to send. eg 0.1

comment.description: A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

comment-to.description: A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

subtractfeefromamount.description: The fee will be deducted from the amount being sent. The recipient will receive less LBC than you enter in the amount field.

setaccount.summary: DEPRECATED. Sets the account associated with the given address.

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to be associated with an account.

account.description: The account to assign the address to.

settxfee.summary: Set the transaction fee per kB. Overwrites the paytxfee parameter.

amount.description: The transaction fee in LBC/kB Result true|false (boolean) Returns true if successful

signmessage.summary: Sign a message with the private key of an address

lbrycrdaddress.description: The lbrycrd address to use for the private key.

message.description: The message to create a signature of.

result.description: The signature of the message encoded in base 64
